snippet: Fighting for custody of his son, Jonathan Sporn has fallen prey to a legal system that excessively privileges the conventional family models.
abstract: Ginia Bellafante Big City column criticizes New York State laws that fail to recognize unconventional family models, to detriment of loving parents who are not biologically related to their children; cites case of Dr Jonathan Sporn, girlfriend committed suicide after giving birth to child conceived through sperm donor, leaving Sporn legally unable to assume custody of baby, which is in foster care despite presence of a loving home.
lead_paragraph: Fighting for custody of his son, Jonathan Sporn has fallen prey to a legal system that excessively privileges the conventional family models.

headline.print_headline: When the Law Says a Parent Isn’t a Parent
headline.seo: A Custody Battle After the Law Says a Parent Isn’t a Parent
headline.main: When the Law Says a Parent Isn’t a Parent
